body_html:
@ebrevdo What do you mean by primitive TF ops? I've trie to use the following, but still it doesn't work :

logits = [0.5, 0.5]
y = [1, 0]

def loss_function_v2(x):
    loss2 = tf.reduce_mean(-tf.multiply(y, tf.log(tf.nn.softmax(x))))
    return loss2

grad_loss = tfe.gradients_function(loss_function_v2)
print grad_loss(logits)[0] # prints correct gradient [-0.5 0.5]

gradgrad_loss = tfe.gradients_function(lambda x: grad_loss(x)[0])
print gradgrad_loss(logits)[0] # this should be [-0.25,  0.25], but it prints [0. 0.]

body:
@ebrevdo What do you mean by primitive TF ops? I've trie to use the following, but still it doesn't work :
```
logits = [0.5, 0.5]
y = [1, 0]

def loss_function_v2(x):
    loss2 = tf.reduce_mean(-tf.multiply(y, tf.log(tf.nn.softmax(x))))
    return loss2

grad_loss = tfe.gradients_function(loss_function_v2)
print grad_loss(logits)[0] # prints correct gradient [-0.5 0.5]

gradgrad_loss = tfe.gradients_function(lambda x: grad_loss(x)[0])
print gradgrad_loss(logits)[0] # this should be [-0.25,  0.25], but it prints [0. 0.]
```
